main event: An observer in Fairfield, California, sighted an orange light larger than a full moon, which gradually decreased in size before disappearing into the night sky.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 5 minutes and occurred at night., The light was described as self-luminous, solid, circular, and orange in color., The observer noted that the light moved straight away but then adjusted its position to the left and back., The sighting was concluded to be possibly a hot air balloon., The observer is a member of the U.S. Navy and reported the event to Mr. Herbert Harris.
witness description: Member of U.S. Navy, Submarine Force, USS Halibut
